attributes.action: Change business rates relief for 25/26 back to 75%.
attributes.additional_details: We feel that businesses have already been affected by increases in employer national insurance contributions, increases in the minimum wage and increased inflation, and that unfortunately, many businesses may not survive, especially given the already challenging economic climate. We urge the Government to increase business rates relief from 40% back to 75%, to support businesses and ensure that the local economy does not suffer further job losses.
attributes.background: We believe the Government’s decision to cut the retail, hospitality and leisure business rates reliefs from 75% to 40% from 1 April could mean thousands of businesses will see business rates bills rise significantly in the year ahead. We believe such rises may be unsustainable for many.

other_parliamentary_business.body:
On 4 June, Sir Gavin Williamson MP will lead a debate on the impact of changes to business rates relief on high street businesses. 
To inform the debate, he would like to hear from you. 
Share your views (https://ukparliament.shorthandstories.com/cet-business-rates-relief/index.html) by midday on 3 June. 
He may quote your response in his debate in Parliament. 
From 4 June, you can:   
Watch the debate   
Read the transcript   
See other relevant material.  
Just use the link above.  
Explainer
Westminster Hall debates give MPs an opportunity to debate a topic of their choice, and receive a response from the Government.  
They are a way to:  
raise awareness of an issue  
seek to influence government policy  
put the views of backbench MPs, political parties, and the Government on record.  
They do not involve a vote on a particular action or decision.  
Visual explainer: Westminster Hall debates (https://ukparliament.shorthandstories.com/cet-business-rates-relief/index.html#group-section-Westminster-Hall-debates-1EvLrHfz2u)
other_parliamentary_business.subject: Business rates relief: MP wants to hear from you
